body.p: Which of the following statements below is true:

multiple_choice.choice: Error that is present in a model is as a result of bias and variance only.
You want to make your model accurate and generalizable by making a trade-off between bias and variance. You also want to make sure your models are flexible as well.
Certain flexible methods will have higher variance and lower bias than a more rigid method.

feedback.p: Incorrect: There are irreducible errors that affect the performance of a model as well.
Incorrect: We want to strike a balance to minimize errors and ensure accuracy but there are tasks were flexibility is not possible.
Correct: When this happens the test MSE increases.

body.p: When you use an extremely flexible method, which of the following is true:

multiple_choice.choice: Using a flexible method like linear regression where there is a linear relationship, there is little to no bias.
Using a flexible method will present higher bias.
Using a flexible method, there is low bias and definitely low bias.

feedback.p: Correct: Flexibility means less bias, interpretability presents bias.
Incorrect: This is not the case. Think about what error can be introduced when there is low flexibility and try again.
Incorrect: This is not always the case.

body.p: When you want to reduce the expected test error of f, you should:

multiple_choice.choice: Select a method that has achieved low variance and low bias.
Select a method that has high flexibility and low interpretability.
Select a method that is highly interpretable and has low flexibility.

feedback.p: Correct: A balanced model will present a lower test error.
Incorrect: You could have high variance and low bias.
Incorrect: You could have high bias and low variance.
